a.title: Family Support Center
a.strong: Link to resources from our Family Support Center

div.span: ASCA is working with the Centers for Disease Control on issues related to how schools work with students on issues surrounding COVID-19 and is helping the CDC develop appropriate and effective messages on how to talk to children about coronavirus.

Here are some suggestions and resources to consider as you provide support to your students regarding COVID-19. Before you take any action, consult with your district to discover any guidance or response initiatives it has in place so your actions align with school and district programs.
Click this link for resources from the ASCA.
National Association of School Psychologists: Talking to Children about COVID 19
NASP: Specific Guidelines

p.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border-width: 0px; border-style: none; border-image: initial;
p.span: It is very important to remember that children look to adults for guidance on how to react to stressful events. If parents seem overly worried, childrens anxiety may rise. Parents should reassure children that health and school officials are working hard to ensure that people throughout the country stay healthy. However, children also need factual, age appropriate information about the potential seriousness of disease risk and concrete instruction about how to avoid infections and spread of disease. Teaching children positive preventive measures, talking with them about their fears, and giving them a sense of some control over their risk of infection can help reduce anxiety.

h2.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Children will react to and follow your verbal and nonverbal reactions.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: What you say and do about COVID-19, current prevention efforts, and related events can either increase or decrease your childrens anxiety.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: If true, emphasize to your children that they and your family are fine.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Remind them that you and the adults at their school are there to keep them safe and healthy.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Let your children talk about their feelings and help reframe their concerns into the appropriate perspective.

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Children may need extra attention from you and may want to talk about their concerns, fears, and questions.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: It is important that they know they have someone who will listen to them; make time for them.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Tell them you love them and give them plenty of affection.

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: When tensions are high, sometimes we try to blame someone.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: It is important to avoid stereotyping any one group of people as responsible for the virus.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Bullying or negative comments made toward others should be stopped and reported to the school.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Be aware of any comments that other adults are having around your family. You may have to explain what comments mean if they are different than the values that you have at home.

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
strong.span: Monitor television viewing and social media.

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Limit television viewing or access to information on the Internet and through social media. Try to avoid watching or listening to information that might be upsetting when your children are present.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Speak to your child about how many stories about COVID-19 on the Internet may be based on rumors and inaccurate information.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Talk to your child about factual information of this diseasethis can help reduce anxiety.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Constantly watching updates on the status of COVID-19 can increase anxietyavoid this.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Be aware that developmentally inappropriate information (i.e., information designed for adults) can cause anxiety or confusion, particularly in young

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Engage your child in games or other interesting activities instead.

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
strong.span: Maintain a normal routine to the extent possible.

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Keep to a regular schedule, as this can be reassuring and promotes physical health.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Encourage your children to keep up with their schoolwork and extracurricular activities, but dont push them if they seem overwhelmed.

h4.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

strong.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;

ul.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 20px 2em; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor; list-style-image: none;

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: In the absence of factual information, children often imagine situations far worse than reality.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Dont ignore their concerns, but rather explain that at the present moment very few people in this country are sick with COVID-19.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: Children can be told this disease is thought to be spread between people who are in close contact with one anotherwhen an infected person coughs or sneezes.

li.style: background: none 0% 0% / auto repeat scroll padding-box border-box transparent; margin: 0px 0px 10px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none currentcolor;
li.span: It is also thought it can be spread when you touch an infected surface or object, which is why it is so important to protect yourself.
